intro: Scabiosa fimbriata, commonly known as the toothbrush flower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or white flowers that resemble a toothbrush. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Scabiosa fimbriata is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
